creator: matthew@davin.ottawa.on.ca
text:
When using http://[3ffe:b00:4041:abcd:202:55ff:fead:15e9]
(insert any IPv6 address) the SERVER_NAME environment variable is set to
 	 3ffe:b00:4041:abcd:202:55ff:fead:15e9
It should be set to
 	 [3ffe:b00:4041:abcd:202:55ff:fead:15e9]

Note that httpd.conf has the following configuration option:
         UseCanonicalName off

Related to bug 19207?

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
There is some mention of this issue in
http://cgi-spec.golux.com/archives/CGI-WG.200304

Any idea what happens with KAME-patched Apache httpd 1.3?

For now I assume that this PR is correct, and we need to
a) not lose the [] when filling out r->hostname
b) add [] when necessary when building server->server_hostname
c) if USE_CANONICAL_NAME_DNS, then add [] if we get numeric
   IP address back instead of hostname

rfc3875 says:


 SERVER_NAME = server-name
      server-name = hostname | ipv4-address | ( "[" ipv6-address "]" )


Now the question is: Would changing this to include the [ ] break many existing applications?
creator: sf@sfritsch.de
nick@webthing.com
text: Bug 47177 was similar, and fixed in 2.2.12.  Is this instance still unfixed?

creator: sf@sfritsch.de
text:
yes, it's still unfixed in trunk. The fix would be as simple as changing a few ap_get_server_name calls into ap_get_server_name_for_url in server/util.c, mod_rewrite, mod_ssl, ap_expr, etc.

I think it should be fixed in 2.3/2.4, but I would like to hear other opinions.
